page.title: 19PENNS LODGE HISTORY
page.content: This house, in the Parish of Brinkworth, has connections with the Penn family. William Penn 1644-1718 was the founder of Pennsylvania. Penn was a Quaker and was often persecuted for his beliefs. In 1618 Penn's father Admiral Sir William Penn died and his son obtained from Charles II's govern- ment,in lieu of his father's claim upon it,a grant of territory in North America. This land was called PENSIL- VANIA in honour of the Admiral.William Penn sailed for America in 1682. He planned the building of Philadelphia and governed the colony justly. He took up the cause of the negroes and heartily condemned the slave trade. Penn made several journeys to England to improve the negroes lot. He even- tually sold his American Rights to the government.His grave is in the grounds of Jordons Meeting House,Beaconsfield.
